US seeks to reassure Ukraine and EU allies over Trump's plan
subhead: The US secretary of state spoke of 'a tremendous amount of progress' during his talks on Sunday with Ukrainian and European officials. However, the counter-proposals from European capitals remained far removed from the plan put forward by the American president.

title: Apple faces class action in France from music streaming users
The French far right and the 'enemies within'
subhead: While far-right leaders Marine Le Pen and Jordan Bardella claim they have no ideology and are, instead, solely guided by 'common sense,' racist and identitarian currents are still represented in their inner circles, analyzes Le Monde columnist Philippe Bernard.

title: South Africa salvages the reputation of a faltering G20 summit
subhead: Boycotted by the United States, the summit still managed to adopt a final declaration. 'The G20 may be reaching the end of a cycle,' Emmanuel Macron wondered.

title: Victor Hugo's interior architecture on display in Paris
subhead: The Maison de Victor Hugo on Place des Vosges unveils a lesser-known side of the writer's life with 'Hugo the decorator,' an exhibition that reveals the creativity he poured into designing his own homes.

title: 'I told him about my day in real time': The couples who can't stop texting on WhatsApp
subhead: While couples in France exchange an average of nine text messages a day, some go far beyond, updating their partner in real time about every event in their day-to-day lives. Is this constant connection a sign of profound intimacy, or a need for control?

subhead: According to the former Trump adviser, 'This White House wants Ukraine to capitulate to Russian demands to end this war, without proper consideration of all the factors at play.'
byline: Interview by Piotr Smolar (Washington (United States) correspondent)

title: Nicolas Guillou, French ICC judge sanctioned by the US: 'You are effectively blacklisted by much of the world's banking system'
subhead: Six judges and three prosecutors at the International Criminal Court have been sanctioned by the Trump administration. In an interview with Le Monde, Guillou discusses the impact of these measures on his work and daily life.
byline: Interview by Stéphanie Maupas (The Hague (Netherlands) correspondent)

title: Ukraine's Pokrovsk faces fierce fighting, footage analyzed by Le Monde reveals
subhead: The major city in the Donbas faces the threat of falling after a slow encirclement by Russian forces. It would be a militarily costly victory, but one that could bolster Vladimir Putin's claims over the region.
byline: By Alexandre Horn, Gabriel Lecointre (edit), Elisa Bellanger (motion design) and Sinead McCausland
